description: A jury awarded $42 million to former detainees of Abu Ghraib prison, holding a military contractor responsible for contributing to their torture.
title: Jury Awards Abu Ghraib Detainees $42 Million, Holds Contractor Responsible

description: Voters must remind U.S. political leaders of the truth in this election: that abortion is more popular than they are.
title: Trump Said He’d Veto a National Abortion Ban. Voters Should Hold Him to His Word

description: Biden plans to offer Trump the grace that Trump never offered him
title: Biden and Trump Prepare for the Most Cringe Meeting in Politics

description: Americans love games of chance, but history shows they're a poor substitute for a robust investment in public goods.
title: The 2024 Election Was the Culmination of America’s Love Affair With Rolling the Dice

description: A judge postponed a decision on whether to undo President-elect Donald Trump’s conviction in his hush money case after he won the election.
title: Judge Delays Ruling on Whether to Scrap Trump’s Conviction in Hush-Money Case

description: TIME Chief Climate Officer Shyla Raghav explores artificial intelligence and how it impacts energy use.
title: Watch: The Good, the Bad, and the Maybe: Artificial Intelligence

description: The heads of the 13 biggest emitters, including the U.S., China, and France, will not be present at this year's U.N. climate change conference.
title: The Leaders of the World’s Top 13 Polluters Are Skipping COP29

description: It’s never too early to start thinking about preserving your bones.
title: 8 Things You Should Do for Your Bones Every Day, According to Orthopedic Doctors

description: 'Superstore' creator Justin Spitzer's latest NBC sitcom does for health care what Quinta Brunson's show has done for education.
title: St. Denis Medical Is the Most Promising Network Sitcom Since Abbott Elementary

description: Today, TIME reveals the second annual TIME100 Climate list, featuring the 100 most influential leaders driving business to real climate action. The 2024 TIME100 Climate list includes president of the World Bank Ajay Banga, founder of Travalyst Prince Harry, Duke of Sussex, actor Rosario Dawson, founder of TerraPower Bill Gates, United States Secretary of Energy…
title: TIME Reveals the 2024 TIME100 Climate List

description: Telling my story makes me feel empowered because what was taken from us Jews and so many others was our very humanity, writes Gidon Lev.
title: Why I’ll Never Stop Sharing My Holocaust Story

description: Police detained a 62-year-old male suspect in Zhuhai following the ramming, which also left 43 people injured.
title: 35 Dead After Driver Rams Into Crowd in Chinese City

description: The second annual TIME100 Climate 2024 list identifies 100 leaders driving measurable, successful, and equitable climate action
title: How We Chose the 100 Most Influential Climate Leaders in Business for 2024

description: Ensuring that the United States’ largest private company, operating in over 70 countries with more than 160,000 personnel, meets its sustainability goals is a challenge. But Pilar Cruz has proven she is the right person for the job at food and beverage multinational Cargill since her role as chief sustainability officer was created in 2021.…
title: Pilar Cruz

description: Cement production is responsible for about 8% of all global emissions—and it’s a stubborn industry to decarbonize because it is so energy-intensive. That’s where Fortera comes in. As CEO and co-founder, Ryan Gilliam is working to make it easy for existing cement plants to become more sustainable by installing technology to capture up to 90%…
title: Ryan Gilliam

description: Find out why Ajay Banga was selected for the list.
title: Ajay Banga

description: In 2020, Sandeep Nijhawan co-founded Colorado-based Electra. Its mission: to decarbonize iron- and steelmaking. Iron production is a hot, energy-intensive process. Today, the steel industry is responsible for about 7% of all global carbon emissions (90% of which come from making iron). But through a novel electrochemical process, powered by renewable energy, Electra is trying…
title: Sandeep Nijhawan

description: Tim Latimer is CEO and co-founder of Fervo Energy, a startup making geothermal energy a viable alternative to fossil fuels. By repurposing technology from the oil and gas industry, Fervo drills deep below the Earth’s surface to reach hot rocks and converts that heat into 24/7 clean energy. Google is already working with Fervo to…
title: Tim Latimer

description: Colin Wessells is the founder and co-CEO of Natron Energy, a company making sodium-ion batteries to power clean technologies. Because sodium is more abundant and more affordable than lithium, sodium-ion batteries could help bolster battery supply chains and accelerate the energy transition. Thanks to Wessells’ vision, Natron is the first – and only – commercial…
title: Colin Wessells

description: Bret Kugelmass, founder and CEO of Last Energy, has a bold vision: To become the first company to bring a small modular nuclear reactor online in the United States. And, as one of the fastest growing companies in this space, it’s working hard to make this a reality. It currently has commercial agreements for 80…
title: Bret Kugelmass

description: Lime helped popularize the climate-friendly concepts of micro-mobility and bike shares that are now seen in many major metropolises around the world; the e-bike rental company operates in more than 280 cities. Last year, it boasted that about five e-bike trips were booked every second—that’s around 156 million trips globally. But beyond helping decarbonize our…
title: Andrew Savage

description: The 30-day ultimatum was missed as humanitarian conditions are worse than at any point in the war, international aid groups said.
title: Israel Misses U.S. Deadline to ‘Surge’ Aid for Gaza, Humanitarian Groups Say

description: The energy company appealed after it had been ordered to cut its carbon emissions by net 45% by 2030 compared to 2019 levels.
title: Dutch Court Overturns Landmark Climate Ruling That Would’ve Made Shell Cut Emissions

description: The congressman leaned on his personal story and military service to build an image as a pragmatic moderate who would work to fix the nation’s broken immigration system and fight for veterans and for reproductive rights.
title: How Democrat Ruben Gallego Won Arizona’s Senate Race Despite Trump Wave

description: Several thousand took to the streets in Belgrade, demanding resignations and arrests of top officials over the deaths of 14 at a railway station.
title: Serbian Protesters Blame Government for Deadly Train Station Roof Collapse

description: It is considered both countries’ biggest defense deal since the end of the Cold War.
title: North Korea and Russia Ratify Defense Treaty

description: The nod would put Waltz at the forefront of a litany of crises—from Ukraine to the Middle East.
title: Donald Trump Asks Rep. Mike Waltz to Be National Security Adviser: What to Know

description: Christopher Luxon made a “formal and unreserved” apology in Parliament for the widespread abuse, torture and neglect of hundreds of thousands of children and vulnerable adults in church and state-run care.
title: New Zealand’s Leader Formally Apologizes to Survivors of Abuse in State and Church Care
